headline: Compared to Estimates, Electronic Arts (EA) Q3 Earnings: A Look at Key Metrics
summary: While the top- and bottom-line numbers for Electronic Arts (EA) give a sense of how the business performed in the quarter ended December 2024, it could be worth looking at how some of its key metrics compare to Wall Street estimates and year-ago values.

headline: Electronic Arts (EA) Q3 Earnings and Revenues Miss Estimates
summary: Electronic Arts (EA) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of -5.35% and 1.68%, respectively, for the quarter ended December 2024. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

raw.headline: Electronic Arts (EA) Q3 Earnings and Revenues Miss Estimates
raw.summary: Electronic Arts (EA) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of -5.35% and 1.68%, respectively, for the quarter ended December 2024. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA) Misses Q4 Sales Targets
summary: Video game publisher Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2024, with sales falling 20.4% year on year to $1.88 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s outlook exceeded expectations with revenue guided to $1.76 billion at the midpoint, or 8% above analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $1.11 per share was 3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

Its GAAP profit of $1.11 per share was 3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Electronic Arts: Fiscal Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The average estimate of 10 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $2.99 per share. The video game maker posted revenue of $1.88 billion in the period. Its adjusted revenue was $2.22 billion, also falling short of Street forecasts.

raw.headline: Electronic Arts: Fiscal Q3 Earnings Snapshot
raw.summary: The average estimate of 10 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $2.99 per share. The video game maker posted revenue of $1.88 billion in the period. Its adjusted revenue was $2.22 billion, also falling short of Street forecasts.

headline: Electronic Arts Reports Q3 FY25 Results
summary: REDWOOD CITY, Calif., February 04, 2025--Electronic Arts Inc. (NASDAQ: EA) today announced preliminary financial results for its third quarter ended December 31, 2024.

headline: The Sims Celebrates 25 Years of Simulated Life
summary: REDWOOD CITY, Calif., February 04, 2025--Electronic Arts Inc. (NASDAQ: EA) proudly celebrates 25 years of The Sims™. Since its launch in 2000, The Sims has captivated players worldwide with its unparalleled creativity and charm. The beloved life simulation game and pop culture phenomenon started from humble beginnings but quickly became one of the best-selling video game franchises of all time, with more than 500 million lifetime players to date.
